Message.Title: Imagine a Low Float Stock that Pays 6% Dividend Yield and Leads Booming Tech Space!
Message.Msg: Here is a once in a lifetime opportunity to make tremendous percentage gains within the next 2-3 weeks! Concurrent (CCUR) grew its operating income over the past four quarters from $187,000 to $413,000 to $876,000 and to $1,233,000 for tremendous operating profit growth of 559%! CCUR announced last week a 100% increase in its cash dividend, which now equals $0.48 per share annually for a yield at $7.95 per share exceeding 6%! CCUR started to breakout big the past couple of days and looks ready to explode into double digits in the upcoming days! CCUR earned non-GAAP EPS of $0.16 last quarter or $0.64 annualized. Based on annualized EPS of $0.64, CCUR's P/E at here $7.95 is an insanely low 12! CCUR had absolutely huge gross margins last quarter of 59% and stunning operating margins of 7.3%! CCUR's current enterprise value (EV) is only $47.22 million or 0.75X sales of $63.23 million and 8X free cash flow of $5.6 million! CCUR's rival Seachange (SEAC) reported gross margins last quarter of only 53.7% and operating margins of negative (5.7%). SEAC here at $11.09 is trading with an EV of $248.92 million or 1.59X sales of $156.11 million and 18.49X free cash flow of $13.46 million! CCUR is about to skyrocket to a fair valuation where it at least matches SEAC's multiples! SEAC currently has an EV/sales ratio of 1.59. CCUR's sales of $63.23 million, with SEAC's EV/sales ratio of 1.59, would give CCUR an EV of $100.54 million and with $22.37 million in cash and no debt, this would equal a market cap for CCUR of $122.91 million and share price of $14.04! SEAC currently has an EV/free cash flow ratio of 18.49. CCUR's free cash flow of $5.6 million, with SEAC's EV/free cash flow ratio of 18.49, would give CCUR an EV of $103.54 million and with $22.37 million in cash and no debt, this would equal a market cap for CCUR of $125.91 million and share price of $14.39! CCUR could easily be trading for between $14.04 and $14.39 per share VERY SOON!

Message.Title: Yahoo's New Look Unveiled
Message.Msg: Yahoo! Inc. (YHOO) CEO Marissa Mayer recently unveiled the new look of the website. The redesigned website will comprise a navigation bar for Yahoo shortcuts at the top of the page with the search tab moving to the left-hand side margin. The right side of the redesigned home page will feature a stack of capsules, which Yahoo calls “utilities”, dedicated to finance, sports, weather, video clips, Flickr for photo sharing and friends’ birthdays. Each of these can be customized or scrapped as per user preference. The left side of the page will display Yahoo services. Yahoo is also working on the structure of the website to considerably reduce loading time. The redesign is aimed at giving the site a cleaner and fresher look.

Topic.Title: Yahoo's New Look Unveiled

Message.Msg: It will attract more users for longer periods of time. That means more ads are seen and Yahoo's revs will grow.

Topic.Title: MSFT will beat Sony where it counts... On the bottom line.

Message.Msg: While I wrote a sweet and detailed rebuttal I'll just leave you with a few points 1. Consoles are sold at a LOSS in the beginning which means you want them in the hands of as many as possible as you recoup via games. XBOX1 shot themselves in the foot. 2. Its NOT a superior product as they're built on the SAME CHIPSET!!! Both are x86-64 8GB GDDR RAM, Jaguar architecture made by AMD. One peaks at 1.83 Teraflops while the other is at 1.23T(Xbox 1). They're essentially TWINS but if you want to say which is superior its PS4. 3. Price has killed great products...in the 90's was a 32-bit system by Panasonic called 3DO, was before PS1 and N64. Its games were great and reasonably priced but cost $700($1100 presently I'm guessing), it wasn't until 2 other makers made them did the price fall to $320, it was too late. For MSFT to stand a chance it needs an installed fan base and with their bungling its going to be mighty difficult especially these 1st few years if they don't change their stance and price to match.

Topic.Title: MSFT will beat Sony where it counts... On the bottom line.
